name: Westin Mission Hills Golf Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had travel miles expiring on one of my cards, and that is how we ended up at Westin Mission Hills Resort. Since it was free, I really should not be complaining... But I will anyway... I saw nothing that would justify charging $300 a night + $25 resort fee. The pool was full, loud, crowded around it, and it did not close on time for the night. People were partying in it until 1am under our windows, even though we were told and there were signs that it closes some days at 10, and some at 11. Their Heavenly Bed gave both of us lots of pain in the morning, and the shower was as simple as in any $50-70 hotel room in Vegas. It's not a bad place, but not for the price they are charging!
reviews.title: Glad it was a free stay...

likes.disliked: — It was too crowded, night-time loud parties!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights over the July 4th weekend. The rates were great for such a nice resort, only $89 per night with the AAA discount! I was a little worried that the resort would be too family-oriented for my husband and me, who don't have kids yet, but I was definitely proven wrong. We had such a nice relaxing stay here lounging by the pool. The rooms were really nice, very new with really comfortable linens, flat screen TV, and very nicely decorated bathrooms with marble countertops, etc. The food at the hotel was not too pricey and was pretty decent - decent enough that we didn't leave the resort our entire stay. Even though the temperature was in the low 100s, it was still comfortable under the umbrellas by the pool. And, they have a great shuttle service to take you wherever you want to go if it's too hot. Get a hot stone massage at the spa! We will definitely return here the next time we need a little getaway.
reviews.title: Great place to relax

reviews.text: The room was very nice, had just about everything you could ask for in a room. As soon as we arrived we went to the pool and returned to the room at about 11:00pm to find huge cockroaches in our bedroom. After an hour of phone calls in to the office, we discovered that the office for the "villas" was closed and that noone could help us. Hotels.com couldn't help us either, but said to make sure to check out at the hotel side. After driving to the hotel side I encountered 'Elizabeth' who called security because I said "[--] cockroaches" and not just cockroaches. I was upset by then, I had driving 3 hours with my children to havea great getaway and we were looking at another 3 hour drive home, without the confirmation of a refund. I never insulted her or called her any curse words, just the cockroaches. After she called security I chucked the key cards over the counter and left. THE COCKROACHES DO MORE WORK THAN THE HOTEL EMPLOYEES.
reviews.title: Huge Cockroaches And Other Cirtters
Gorgeous resort
reviews.text: Great stay but we were there on a "by invitation" program so it was a real deal - not sure if worth $300+ per night in the summer. Second pool closed mid day for private event - not appropriate for size of facility. Bella Vista food and service was terrific but restaurant was almost empty.

The most recent reviews pretty much sum up the hotel. It is a sprawling site with several pools. The biggest one was well attended, but became murky towards end of day. There was a small, nicer pool right next to our room, but it was "adults only" so we couldn't take our toddler. The rooms were average, having just seen renovation - but they were below the standards I would consider for the Westin Brand. The one restaurant was just ok. The many flies that kept buzzing around at least got us a free martini and dessert.
reviews.title: Don't bother with the time share offer.

reviews.text: By far my favorite hotel in the Palm Springs area. I was impressed from the moment I drove up to the hotel, to the moment I left. I checked in at 3AM and the hotel had packages from my work waiting for me at the front desk. Although it was late when I checked in, a staff member drove me from the lobby to my hotel room (HUGE PROPERY!). The room was very large and impressive. The heavenly bed and shower were amazing. In the morning I wanted breakfast before it was officially served and they brought it to me early (I had to be at work at 6 AM). I also forgot my toothbrush and razor and a staff member brought me both free of charge. I was really impressed with the property and service. The hotel is beautiful and the pool area is exceptional. I could hang out at this hotel for a week straight and not leave the property. I will definitely return to the Resort as my stay was top notch!
reviews.title: Top Notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a one night stay at The Westin (1st night at Marriott Desert Springs). This resort is spread across 43 acres and is more like a giant condominium complex than a traditional hotel (a la Marriott). We stayed in building 16. It was newly remodeled which was obvious by the smell of new carpet (no complaint btw - who doesn't want to be in a brand new room?). The room are gigantic! There's the trusted heavenly bed and linens which are fab. The bathroom was awesome - 2 sinks, spacious counter top (that never happens), and tasteful decor. It was very quiet and mellow. Clearly a place for long term visitors and there are timeshares, I'm sure. We made it to the small pool close to our room which was small but nice. We didn't go to the larger main pool off the lobby but heard it was crowded. Having just stayed at bachelorette/bachelor party central at the Marriott, I can't imagine this pool could come close to the same atmosphere. Getting around takes a bit of walking or driving but it's not something that should turn you off if you're looking for a quieter, more family oriented, or romantic getaway vibe. Just a reminder, I wouldn't describe this as a hotel, it's a big resort for vacationers, condo owners, and timeshare folks but they offer all the amenities of a hotel.
reviews.title: Newly remodeled, spacious, mellow resort

likes.liked: — The Heavenly Bed and spacious bathroom.
likes.disliked: — The pool bar closed too early.

reviews.text: Every time I think of great service and great rooms, I think of the Westin.
reviews.title: Great Experience(s) at the Westin Mission Hills

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, the service excellent. I like how they refer to you as "Mr." or "Miss" each time you call the front desk and how quickly they aim to please the customer. That's what service at a hotel is about... accommodating the needs of the traveler!
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay and Pleasant Staff!

reviews.text: The pools are very clean and well-maintained. The drinks at the bar are great. Everyone that works there is very pleasant. Food at the restaurants is good. It's within a short driving distance from downtown Palm Springs, but you feel like you're miles away when you stay here...it's definitely a getaway!
reviews.title: Nice Stay- Comfortable Rooms
Narcotics Convention Spoiled my Trip
reviews.text: I stayed here the 4th of July Weekend. I was shocked to learn they were hosting a NARCOTICS ANONYMOUS convention. The attendees (guest) included people in drug rehab. There were hundreds of men and women with tatoos all over their bodies. The water slide line was full of GROWN men drinking and cursing. Most of the guest appeared to be on drugs. Large men were jumping in 4 feet of water. It was a spooky situation. One man constantly stared at my daughter. I did not expect a hotel of this caliber to host such a convention. I told my 10 year old daughter that I feared for her saftey so we checked in at Jw Marriott.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked the resort through Hotwire for $85 a night . We were very pleased with the property ..We stayed in building 5 near the adult pool that we were able to enjoy every day. The room overlooked the golf course and it was a beautiful view, the staff were very help and provided us a refrigerator in our room and were very helful. I would highly recommend this property.....
reviews.title: We Loved IT!!!1

reviews.text: Seeing as we were booked with a $199.00 a night room with a $200.00/day spa credit I suppose I have very little room to complain...but I will anyway. We checked in at 4:30 pm to find they only had king sized beds available, I like my girlfriend but not that much. The original response by the front desk was,
reviews.title: so-so stay

reviews.text: "well it has a king sized sofa bed"...my response," is it a heavenly sofa bed?" . After some hemming and hawing and 20 minutes they found us a pool view 2nd floor 2 queen room. Let us just say it needed some work, nice sized room but the shower/tub was in disrepair...think super 8 budget lodge not the marble spa like bathroom they advertise. The spa was nice and I would probally use it again but not stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: enjoyed westin mission hills

likes.disliked: — walking back and forth from room to rest of resort

reviews.text: we stayed here in february 2007 and were immediately impressed with the lovely and immaculate grounds. check in took a little while as there was only one person working the counter. our room was big and had a patio and was very comfortable. it was a little far away from the center of the resort (the restaurant, pool, golf course) but a convenient distance from the meeting halls and spa/fitness center. it is a very large and sprawling property. we played and loved both of the golf courses. the pool has a beautiful view of the mountains and was never too crowded to find lounge chairs. there was a water slide for younger kids and two jacuzzis. also, there were two ducks that were always around and sometimes in the pool. (we personally found this adorable, though i guess there are people who would mind). the restaurant had a solid though unchanging menu with pretty decent food, if a little on the expensive side. definitely have a car because there is lots to do in the surrounding area...definitely do the aerial tramway. the desert zoo was great too. there are also some nice restaurants in the town of palm springs...we went to uptown grill which we liked alot (great calmari). the evenings can get pretty chilly (atleast in the winter time) which we werent expecting but the weather was beautiful during the day. some of the other reviews cite bad service, but it was actually quicker than many other resorts, and they were all nice. overall i highly recommend westin mission hills...we had a lovely stay here.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.text: It was usual Westin business.
reviews.title: no surprise

reviews.text: Large room, clean, quiet, with modern amenities, with no view. Cheap ($90) because booked on hotwire.
reviews.title: Nice place, nice location, indifferent service

reviews.text: The hotel is too large : you have to walk quite a long distance to the swimming pool or to the restaurant. Better to take your car !!
reviews.title: Memorial Day Getaway

likes.liked: — The shuttle service to points of interest at the resort
likes.disliked: — No poolside cocktail service at Las Hadas Pool

reviews.text: When arriving I went to the villas first, which is in the same resort but with a separate front desk. It took them 10 minutes to find why they had no room for me !!! No apologies...
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: Modern fitness center.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds - terrible service!

reviews.text: I've been to the Westin Mission Hills Resort twice in the last 5 years for work. Both times I've generally enjoyed my stay. The rooms were very nice and the staff has been friendly and for the most part helpful. The restaurants on site are pricey but there are lots of great places within a 15 minute drive. My big gripe is that for a resort, the fitness facilities are really third rate. They have 1990's vintage cardio equipment and the weights are outside under an awning. It was 106 degrees when I was there - this is not Venice Beach! Considering I had to pay a $25 "resort fee" per day I was VERY disappointed.
reviews.title: Good but could be better

likes.disliked: — lousy fitness center and very pricey bars and restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent two nights in this resort. That was just amazing. The place is clean and the rooms are spacious. Some of the buildings were being renovated. I stayed in Unit 3 and I really enjoyed morning breeze and sceneries when I want out for a jog, I will recommend making a left turn when you exit the resort and be prepared to enjoy the Mountain View and desertic environment. Good place for walk,jog and biking. The only drawback swimming pools get really crowded during the weekend.
reviews.title: Lovely Place

reviews.text: We (my husband and 2 kids) went to spend a week-end at the Westin Mission Hills. Despite the very pleasant and confortable room, it has been a terrible experience. We arrived at 3:30pm and the room was not ready. They took our phone number and tols us they will call as soon as ready not knowing if it would be a question of minutes of hours. They didn't give us any alternative as "you have the swimming pool there or the restaurant is opened and you will find it there, ..." They just left us in the middle of the reception. After 1h30, as we did not have any news we went back at the reception to hear they have forgotten to call us and our room was ready for a while but did not apologize! We had to find our room by ourselves. No assistance has been offered even to ke the luggage on the 1st floor with no elevator. Then we decided to go to the swimming pool. AWFUL! The water was dirty not to mention the swimming pool area full of empty glasses, plates of food, ... We were so desappointed we decided to visit Palm Springs and have dinner outside. The next morning, for the breakfast we had to wait 20mn to be seated while a lot of table were empty. We had to ask 3 times for the menu. Eggs were not cooked properly! Service was a disaster. We were to spend the full day before going back home but finally we left right after breakfast very desappointed! For sure we won't come back and will not recommend this hotel to our friends!
reviews.title: Horrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Mission Hills Resort is a great selection for looking for a prime location with great accommodations from a very friendly staff. The hotel is conveniently located on the corner of Dinah Shore and Bob Hope Drive which is near a casino, and in between the two hot spots of the desert area, the River and Downtown Palm Springs. The River features fine restaurant chains, with a big book store, coffee shops, bars and ice cream parlors. Downtown Palm Springs, on the other hand, features independently/family own restaurants, bars and some very nice art galleries. On Thursday nights the streets are closed down to accommodate street vendors that come to the area and sell some art and food goodies. You can't miss this.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with lots of potential

reviews.text: As far as the hotel, the Westin is a very nice comfortable atmosphere with a very nice staff that seem to help you out with all your accommodations. They were genuinely nice people. The rooms were very basic, with a nice bar, couches, tvs, etc. The are overally sized and VERY CLEAN. And like a previous reviewer mentioned, they are undergoing a 56 million dollar rennovation that only promises state of the art rooms equiped with tech goodies for those are tech savvy. The pools were very nice as well, including the drinks they served.
reviews.title: Pleasant, but will benefit greatly from pending upgrade

reviews.text: The resort is HUGE! That can be good or bad depending on whether or not you like walking. They do have golf-cart shuttles that go around the property so you don't have to walk too far but be prepared to foot it for most of the stay.
reviews.title: Huge resort, great for couples or families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very nice. Great decor, beautiful bathrooms and the beds were very comfortable. The linens boasted high thread counts but felt quite stiff. There was plenty of space and the room had a nice sitting area with a sofabed that would be perfect for families with children.
reviews.title: Not bad, not superb either....

likes.liked: — value for money, based on the timeshare offer

reviews.title: Be scared .very Scared
reviews.text: There were three pools on the property. The main pool has a water slide, a volleyball court and two hot tubs. The pool was way too warm to be relaxing and the water didn't seem too clean. The hot tub had way too much chlorine and started to burn our eyes after about 3 minutes inside of it. There are two smaller pool areas outside of the main pool, one of which is an Adults only pool area which is great for couples looking to relax without getting bonked in the head by a rubber football being tossed around by some kids.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and the few interactions we had were good. There is ample parking around each of the guest room buildings so it was hardly ever a long walk from your car to the room. If you are going there during the summer months expect the weather to be in the triple digits. We didn't mind because the A/C worked perfectly in the room and when you walk around at night there is a slight breeze that keeps you somewhat comfortable.
reviews.title: Complete infrastructure failure

reviews.text: There are also tennis courts, golf courses and a gym but we didn't use any of them so I can't comment on them.
reviews.title: Great Service - Great Room
Great desert resort
reviews.text: Stayed at this resort for a conference and had a wonderful time. The property is spread out and offers an excellent pool, unique lobby, and a true desert feeling. The rooms were nice -- typical for Westin resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third or fourth time at this hotel. Each visit has been about the same - neither good or bad. A few things that really got me this time was the fact that 1) the TV remote didn't work and it took maintenance over a day to get us a replacement. 2) Every single lamp in the room was unplugged. I had to move one of the beds to find a plug, and 3) the internet didn't work in the room due to a bad connector.
reviews.title: Not As Good As It Could Be

likes.disliked: — Expensive and room had a few problems.

reviews.text: None of these things made the stay bad, but given the caliber of the hotel, all these little things being wrong with the room made the stay just average.
reviews.title: Nice but HOT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One other thing I don't like is the fact that there are NO vending machines anywhere on the property. One overpriced store is the only place to buy a 20 oz soda, at near airport prices of $2.42.
reviews.title: Hot times under the desert sun!

likes.liked: — location, size, spa, pet-friendly, clean, good size rooms and bathrooms, lots of amenities

reviews.text: my family stayed here for 4 nights as part of a timeshare thing. they have you go to a timeshare meeting for 90 minutes and you get a room for less than 100 dollars a night. it's a great deal. you just agree with the sales rep for the entire thing but then you say no.
reviews.title: OK but could be better.

likes.liked: — Bedding, Large Rooms, Pool Slide (when operating, hours are short)
likes.disliked: — Room in disrepair, poor staff communication, impersonal staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After turning down multiple offers to see a timeshare, we agreed to stay at this resort, without taking the tour. Still had to prepay at a good rate and still got certificates to pay for the resort fee. We arrived on Thursday, so with many rooms open in late July, our corner room faced the pool. Any room facing the pool or golf course would be great, I would not want to face another room or the parking lot (old resort design). The room was updated and looked like other nice Westin hotels. Only complaint was the room was noisy, other rooms and anyone by the pool (even though it was supposed to close by 10).
reviews.title: Updated Westin Resort

likes.liked: — Updated room and pool area for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really liked that they did not have staff by the West pool, where you could have drinks/coolers, etc. (but this was off-season). Clean pool, grounds, etc. Nice waterfalls surrounding pool areas - sound, sight. The weekend had a large convention, so parking was tight, they did have golf carts to take you from your car to your building. Ate breakfast at the nearby casino, nice $8 buffet, couldn't get myself to go to the hotel restaurants. Honest, reputable staff (or didn't like beer), couldn't find one to take my leftover beer. Staff requests were prompt (towels, pillows, etc.), except one request took a second call to get the sliding door safety stop.
reviews.title: An Oasis of Luxury in the harsh California desert

likes.liked: — Westin continues its high standards - even in the middle of nowhere

reviews.text: Overall, I would go again during low to mid season, I would not like the crowd during peak season by the pool or parking lot. They had a dive-in pool movie and volleyball net at the main pool. Not the best, but definitely not as bad as I was expecting based on the reviews (maybe other negative reviews were before the updated rooms?). I was comfortable in the room, also on the patio (good patio set) next to the 'river' and next to the pool as well as the nice cushion lounges by the pool. If you are a runner, nice walkway/cartway going West on Dinah Shore.
reviews.title: Nice Resort

reviews.text: A dose of summer heat in luxurious surroundings was what was required and we found it here at the Westin. The hotel was in tip-top condition and our room was huge with two sinks in the bathroom and closet area and a separate shower area. It was also exceptionally good value for money at just over $110 a night. One thing to bare in mind is that the complex itself covers a vast amount of area and there are 3 pools to choose from. The central/main pool behind the main building is by far the nicest – complete with waterslide and bar area. We had no trouble getting an umbrella to sit under each day, but there does appear to be something of a shortage. After 10 minutes in the sun, you will be seeking shade and be glad to know that there is some nearby.
reviews.title: Loved the room, Hated the cockroaches

likes.disliked: — the cockroaches and hotel staff or lack there of

reviews.text: At one point I was thinking if I would have been better off to have picked Le Meridian, however after taking a look, if it’s pool and a sunbed you’re after, the Westini has to be the place. Le Meridian was very “alternative” and the pool area looked dated – like something out of the 50s. It is clear that in this sense, very little updating has gone on. The pool itself was tiny. I was glad that we had chosen to stay at the Westin. It was an oasis of luxury and relaxation in the middle of the harsh, hot California dessert.
reviews.title: Liked the grounds but hated the timeshare sales angle

aka: Westin Mission Hills Resort And Spa
description: The Westin Mission Hills Golf Resort & Spa is a Palm Springs resort and hotel where the picturesque mountain views and secluded location create the perfect escape. Our Palm Springs hotel is the perfect place to unwind. Enjoy the best Palm Springs Golf on one of our championship courses, lounge at any of our three pools, splash down our 60-foot waterslide or enjoy a delectable meal at one of our Palm Springs restaurant options, including the new Pinzimini. A soothing sanctuary awaits those looking for a rejuvenating desert retreat with our expansive Palm Springs resort spa featuring treatments for everyone.
